items.sentence: Why don\'t you tell me how you think it happened?
Why don\'t you try putting a little salt on that?
You can\'t possibly really think Tom is a doctor.
You didn\'t need to tell me that. I already knew.
Tom wrote his name on the cover of his new diary.
Tom wrote me more than thirty messages yesterday.
How many hours a day do you spend in your office?
I advised him not to spend all his money on food.
I asked Tom if he really wanted to do that today.
I think I\'ve found what we\'ve been looking for.
I want my children to reach their full potential.
I want to be certain you are who you say you are.
I want to eat something that I can only eat here.
The kidnappers tied Tom\'s hands behind his back.
You should assume that Tom won\'t help us at all.
Why does it hurt when you get sweat in your eyes?
I\'ve already told everybody about what happened.
Tom spends most of his free time studying French.
Tom spends way too much time thinking about Mary.
Does Tom think he\'ll be in Australia all summer?
